name: garter ear flap hat
sizes_available: baby, toddler, kid, adult small, adult medium, adult large
notes:
materials

- 1 (1, 1, 2, 2, 3) skein(s) of purl soho’s [plenty][1], 100% extra fine merino. each skein is 139 yards/ 100 grams; approximately 80 (100, 135, 165, 215, 260) total yards required. we used mint blue, reed gray, and fresh fig.
- us 8 (5 mm), 12-inch (for baby size) or 16-inch [circular knitting needles][2]
- us 7 (4.5 mm), 12-inch (for baby size) or 16-inch circular needles
- a set of us 7 [double pointed needles][3]
- removable [stitch markers][4], including one unique

note: prefer to make your hat using [magic loop][5]? just swap the 12- or 16-inch circular needles and double pointed needles above for 32-inch or longer needles of the same size!

(note: an earlier version of this pattern was knit using 1–2 skeins of purl soho’s [alpaca pure][6] (no longer available) in the colors heirloom white (artemisia, storm gray) for the baby (kid, adult medium) hats. click [here][7] for more on this version.)

gauge
17 stitches and 32 rows/rounds = 4 inches in garter stitch with smaller needles

sizes 
baby (toddler, kid, adult small, adult medium, adult large)

- finished circumference: 14 (16, 17¾, 19¾, 21¾, 23½) inches, comfortably stretching 1–2 inches
- finished height: 7¼ (8, 9, 10, 11½, 12¾) inches, from bottom of ear flap to top of hat (not including tassel)

samples: the mint blue hat is the baby size; the reed gray hat is the kid size; and the fresh fig hat is the adult medium size.


designed for purl soho by laura ferguson.


garngladje has translated this pattern into swedish: http://www.ravelry.com/patterns/sources/garngladje
